Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the Azure Firewall deployment, including network topology, traffic flow, and security policies. Identify the applications and services that will be protected by the firewall.
Design the network architecture, including the placement of the Azure Firewall, subnets, and route tables. Ensure integration with existing on-premises and Azure networks.
Obtain necessary approvals and authorizations, such as budget approval and security team sign-off, for deploying Azure Firewall.
Create a dedicated subnet named 'AzureFirewallSubnet' in the virtual network where the Azure Firewall will be deployed.
Deploy the Azure Firewall instance in the designated virtual network and subnet. Configure the basic settings such as SKU, availability zones, and public IP addresses.
Define and configure network rules, application rules, and NAT rules to control traffic flow and enforce security policies.
Enable diagnostic logging and integrate Azure Firewall with Log Analytics to monitor traffic and detect anomalies.
Enable threat intelligence-based filtering and configure alerts for malicious traffic. Ensure compliance with organizational security standards.
Perform thorough testing of the Azure Firewall configuration, including rule validation, traffic flow, and failover scenarios.
Update route tables to direct traffic through the Azure Firewall. Ensure proper routing for both inbound and outbound traffic.
Configure Azure Monitor and alerts to track the health and performance of the Azure Firewall. Set up notifications for critical events.
Document the Azure Firewall configuration, including rules, route tables, and monitoring setup. Share the documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Firewall, including rule updates and monitoring.
Conduct regular audits of the Azure Firewall configuration and logs to ensure compliance with security policies and identify potential issues.
Periodically review and update firewall rules to accommodate changes in application requirements or security policies. Remove outdated or unnecessary rules.
Use Azure Monitor and Azure Firewall logs to continuously monitor the health and performance of the firewall. Investigate any anomalies or potential issues.
Conduct regular security audits to ensure the firewall configuration adheres to organizational security standards and best practices.
Regularly back up the Azure Firewall configuration to ensure recovery in case of accidental changes or failures.
Test and validate network connectivity through the firewall to ensure proper routing and access control.
Rotate encryption keys used by the firewall to ensure compliance with security policies and reduce the risk of key compromise.
Analyze firewall logs to identify potential security threats, unusual traffic patterns, or misconfigurations.
Conduct failover tests to ensure the firewall can handle traffic during outages or disruptions in primary network paths.
Review and optimize firewall performance settings to ensure efficient handling of network traffic and minimal latency.
Perform incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents or firewall outages.
Evaluate the firewall's performance against the SLA metrics and address any deviations.
Develop and execute plans for Azure Firewall upgrades or expansions as needed. Ensure minimal disruption during these activities.
Gather and analyze user feedback regarding firewall performance and reliability. Implement improvements based on this feedback.
